thread.title: Bizarre rugby film may have inspired Japanese players to victory
thread.title_full: Bizarre rugby film may have inspired Japanese players to victory - Telegraph

author: Telegraph Sport
title: Bizarre rugby film may have inspired Japanese players to victory
text: You might recall Japan triumphing over South Africa last weekend , a remarkable underdog triumph the likes of which had never before been seen in rugby. You might want to forget that the Japanese players followed that performance up with a disappointing defeat to Scotland . As they say, you can’t win them all. Setting aside the defeat for a moment, the obvious question is how exactly did Japan coach Eddie Jones mastermind the historic victory in the first match? Intensive training? Inspired tactics? A motivational team talk? Perhaps it was none of the above. Footage has emerged this week of a Japanese film about the sport that might just have given the players all the inspiration needed. The game depicted seems to involve both humans and mythical creatures. Lasers seem to be permitted and choice lines of dialogue include, “Flagrant fouls by the dark star cluster” and “That was a nice try, and a nice goal.” Despite the presence of aliens on the pitch, there is still an inexplicable lack of supporters in the ground. The clip is below, give it a watch and try to make sense of proceedings. Telegraphsportpage Follow @telegraphsport
